note.p: Death: His residence, Nizell's House, near Tunbridge (10 June 1864)

Originally an ivory turner, but came to London and began working as a mechanical assistant to Mr Charles Dumergue of Piccadilly. At the same time he attended regularly at anaotomical and surgical lectures. Started in practice on his own account at 32 Old Burlilngton Street (1731-1857); Did much to improve his profession, and sis said for some years to have been in the receipt of an imcome of upwards of Â£10,000. Retired in 1857.
Freemason, initiated 10 December 1825, Royal Somerset House and I:nverness Lodge No 6, subsequently No 4 London.
Library and Museum of Freemasonry, 'Freemasons and the Royal Society: Alphabetical List of Fellows who were Freemasons' 2010, page 17
